section.title: Overview
section.para: The following sections provides a brief overview of the features offered by &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER;.

section.title: Hardware Overview
section.para: &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER; supports both 32-bit and 64-bit processor architectures manufactured by Intel and AMD.

listitem.para: Kernel - The Linux kernel shipped with &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER; is &KERNELVER; which is the latest kernel branch which will be supported for a long term period.
Plymouth - The bootsplash technology used in &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER; is the brand new Plymouth engine.
YALI - YALI, the installer of Pardus, gained LVM/RAID and UUID support.

KDE - &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER; comes with KDE &KDEVER;, the old KDE stack which has proven its stability and reliability. The base packages also contains numerous fixes which will improve the stability of your desktop experience significantly.

NetworkManager - GNOME NetworkManager 0.8.2 is the default networking backend in &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER;. Users are now able to set up their HSPA/CDMA/VPN networks together with the already supported Ethernet and 802.11 WLAN networks.
LibreOffice - LibreOffice, an Open Source personal productivity suite sponsored by the Document Foundation, is the default Office Suite in &DISTRONAME; &PRODVER;.
